intro: Ranunculus sommieri, commonly known as the summer ranunculus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow or orange flowers with five to eight petals, and it produces small, green, oval-shaped fruits. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a characteristic species of Mediterranean flora and its use in horticulture for ornamental purposes.
